page.title: 05Along the Old Railway Track.
page.content: It was a lovely hot day and the view was superb.Along the side of the track we saw some hut circles (the remains of Bronze Age homes) and the ruins of old signal boxes. When we got to King Tor Halt we saw two disused quarries, Foggintor quarry and Swelltor quarry. The line was originally built to carry granite from the quarries to Plymouth. The granite from Swelltor quarry was used to build London Bridge. From King Tor Halt the track makes a huge loop, several miles long around King Tor because the gradient is so steep but we could see the reurn line only a short distance away.From Princetown to Yelverton is six miles, as the crow flies but the track covers eleven.The ladies in the canteen used to travel on the railway and they told us how lovely it was.I hope they wll re-open the Princetown line again.
